intro: Batanthes attenuata, commonly known as the slender batanthes, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically arranged in umbellate clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
